pages.title: 15 ▪ The Devil ▪ ע
pages.text: Child of the Forces of Time

The Horned Goat, with wings like those of a bat, is standing on an altar.$(br)  Its right hand is upraised and extended, being the reverse of that benediction which is given by $(l:patchouli:major/5the_hierophant)The Hierophant$().$(br)  In the left hand there is a great flaming torch, inverted towards the earth.$(br)  There is a ring in front of the altar, from which two chains are carried to the necks of two figures, male and female. These are analogous

to the card of $(l:patchouli:major/6the_lovers)The Lovers$(), as if they had fallen under different circumstances.$(br)  Hereof is the chain and fatality of the material life.$(br)  The man and woman are tailed, to signify the animal nature, but there is human intelligence in their gait.$(br)  The exalted beast above them is not to be their master for ever. Even as their master, it is also a slave to the evil desire for oppresion.$(br)  When realization strikes, the three will be free at once.

The beast is in fact the dweller on the threshold outside the Mystical Garden, guarding it from those that have eaten of the fruits therein.$(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Struggles with oppression.$(br)  Illusions. Dark feelings or desires, especially passionate ones.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Liberation, redemption.$(br)  Bringing things to light.
